sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A new treatyse in maner of a dialoge, whiche sheweth the excellency of man[n]es nature in that he is made to the image of God, and wherein it restyth, and by howe many wayes a man dothe blotte, and defyle the same image. Huggarde, Miles.
[32] p.
Imprynted by me Robert wyer, dwellinge in S. Martins paryshe at Charynge Crosse. Ad imprimendum solum, [[London] : [1550?]]
By Miles Huggarde, whose name appears in the penultimate stanza of "The lenvoy of the auctor". Title from caption title, leaf A1r. Imprint from colophon; publication date suggested by STC. In verse. Imperfect?; lacks title page. Signatures: A-D⁴. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
A new treatyse in maner of a dialoge, whiche sheweth the excellency of man[n]es nature in that he is made to the image of God, and wherein it restyth, and by howe many wayes a man dothe blotte, and defyle the same image. Huggarde, Miles.
[32] p.
Imprynted by me Robert wyer, dwellinge in S. Martins paryshe at Charynge Crosse. Ad imprimendum solum, [[London] : [1550?]]
By Miles Huggarde, whose name appears in the penultimate stanza of "The lenvoy of the auctor". Title from caption title, leaf A1r. Imprint from colophon; publication date suggested by STC. In verse. Imperfect?; lacks title page. Signatures: A-D⁴. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
me Robert wyer
S. Martins paryshe at Charynge Crosse. Ad imprimendum solum
>>>>>>> imprintparse
